body_html:
@PiotrDabkowski Is there any tradeoff with using eps=1e-8 or eps=1e-5? I am able to avoid NaN with 1e-5 but I am still getting NaN with 1e-8. How should I check if it is fine with 1e-5?

It also works with 1e-6 but interestingly it performs worse than 1e-5. I would think that 1e-6 is smaller so it is more "precise", i.e. less deviation from the true value.

Any particular reason why a bigger eps can work better?
